entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 6:28AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds With Blowing Snow Expected This Weekend... East winds will increase along the Arctic Coast from Utqiagvik east late tonight through Saturday and remain strong into Sunday. Expect the strongest winds from Deadhorse east Friday night through Saturday night when gusts of 50 to 60 mph are possible along with low visibility in blowing snow. Utqiagvik can expect
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northern Arctic Coast

entry.summary: ...Additional rainfall to bring the potential for river flooding... The area includes northwest Ohio and much of northern Indiana Friday into Saturday. entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 3:19AM MST until January 13 at 5:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches between Thursday morning and Saturday morning. Localized areas above 10,000 feet elevation could see up to two feet of total snowfall. Winds gusting as high as 60 to 70 mph, especially Friday morning into Friday evening.
